project_description: Software for storing and managing Proof-Carrying Data (PCD) - cryptographically verifiable data storage and selective disclosure of personal credentials, initially developed for the Zuzalu community as a digital passport

protocols: Semaphore Protocol (anonymous signaling and group membership)
implementations: General Purpose Circuits (GPCs) - pre-compiled ZK circuits with human-readable configuration
Custom zkSNARK circuits for application-specific queries
ZK proofs for social graph analysis (e.g., degrees of separation)
features: Group membership proofs without revealing identity
Proof of event attendance without revealing specific identity
Degrees of separation proofs (e.g., connection to specific individuals)
Financial health verification without exposing details
Social media verification while preserving privacy

pcd_structure.claim: Structured data fields with cryptographic identifiers
pcd_structure.proof: Cryptographic proof attached to the claim (signatures, Merkle proofs, ZK proofs, hash commitments)

operations: Redaction - Hide sensitive data while maintaining verifiability
Transformation - Modify data with end-to-end verifiability
Aggregation - Combine multiple PCDs with maintained integrity

provable_object_data.description: Standard for cryptographic data that enables storage and sharing of data while preserving its integrity
provable_object_data.data_structure: Arbitrary key/value data that can be signed and distributed

general_purpose_circuits.description: Highly-configurable family of circuits for creating flexible proofs about PODs without app-specific circuits or trusted setup
general_purpose_circuits.configuration: Simple configuration language compiled to GPCs
capabilities: Redact sensitive fields while proving claims about remaining data
Transform POD content with cryptographic guarantees
Aggregate multiple PODs into composite proofs
Prove relationships between POD fields without revealing values

advanced_features: Elliptic curve operations in zero knowledge

privacy_guarantees: Selective disclosure - reveal only necessary information
Data integrity without exposing raw data
No trusted third-party required for verification

attendance_proofs: Prove event attendance without revealing identity
Gated access to communities and platforms
selective_sharing: Share credentials without revealing personal details
Create proofs about ticket ownership without exposing the ticket
Batch proofs for multiple event attendances

components: Passport web application (client for managing PCDs)
PCD SDK (development kit for PCD-based applications)

key_innovations: General Purpose Circuits (GPCs) eliminate need for app-specific circuit development
POD standard enables interoperability across applications
No trusted setup required for ZK proofs
Consumer-friendly cryptography without requiring cryptographic expertise
Programmable cryptography with simple configuration language
use_cases: Financial health attestations without revealing details

deployment_info.deployment_status: Production - Active at major ETH conferences

notable_implementations: Zuzalu Passport - Used by 800+ participants for 2 months
Devcon Passport - Official credential system for Ethereum Devcon
FrogCrypto - Anonymous frog collectibles with ZK proofs

research_metadata.verification_status: Multi-source verified - Real data from official repository
research_metadata.verification_method: Direct inspection of GitHub repository, package.json files, NPM packages, and official documentation
research_metadata.research_completeness: COMPLETE - Full tech stack, privacy techniques, and deployment verified
research_metadata.researcher_notes: Zupass represents a significant advancement in consumer-friendly zero-knowledge cryptography. The introduction of PODs (Provable Object Data) and GPCs (General Purpose Circuits) removes major barriers to ZK adoption by eliminating the need for custom circuit development and trusted setups. The system has been battle-tested at major events like Zuzalu and Devcon, demonstrating real-world viability. Comprehensive monorepo with 50+ @pcd packages published on NPM. Uses Semaphore V3/V4 for anonymous group proofs. Production deployment at zupass.org with active API at api.zupass.org.
